resources.string: Manage WLAN, Bluetooth, aeroplane mode, mobile networks, & VPNs
%1$s manages your device and doesn’t allow modifying or deleting this WLAN network. For more information, contact your administrator.
"Don't use a WLAN network unless it has a good Internet connection"
Let a WLAN assistant automatically connect to open networks determined to be high quality
To improve location accuracy, system apps and services can still scan for WLAN networks. You can change this in LINK_BEGINscanning settingsLINK_END.
Minimise battery usage when WLAN is on
Switch to mobile data if WLAN loses Internet access.
To see available networks, turn WLAN on.
"You don't have permission to change the WLAN network."
Press the WLAN Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \"WPS\" or marked with this symbol:
Enter pin %1$s on your WLAN router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.

"To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, %1$s wants to turn on network scanning, even when WLAN is off.
Allow this for all apps that want to scan?"
WARNING: If you skip WLAN, your phone will only use mobile data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to WLAN.

"If you skip WLAN:
"
Your phone won’t have an Internet connection."
"
You won’t get software updates until you connect to the Internet."
"
You can’t activate device protection features at this time.
The phone was unable to connect to this WLAN network.
Use mobile connection to provide WLAN network
AndroidAP WPA2 PSK portable WLAN hotspot

"This will reset all network settings, including:
"
WLAN" "
Mobile data" "
Bluetooth
Use GPS, WLAN, Bluetooth or mobile networks to determine location
Use WLAN, Bluetooth or mobile networks to determine location
Improve location by allowing system apps and services to detect WLAN networks at any time.
Increase WLAN logging level, show per SSID RSSI in WLAN Picker
When enabled, WLAN will be more aggressive in handing over the data connection to Mobile, when WLAN signal is low
Allow/Disallow WLAN Roam Scans based on the amount of data traffic present at the interface
Always keep mobile data active, even when WLAN is active (for fast network switching).
"Turn off WLAN when not using it or when it isn't available"
Back up app data, WLAN passwords and other settings to Google servers
Stop backing up your WLAN passwords, bookmarks, other settings and app data, plus erase all copies on Google servers?
Stop backing up device data (such as WLAN passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps), plus erase all copies on Google Drive?

"Automatically back up device data (such as WLAN passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos."
"You can't configure an EAP WLAN connection during setup. After setup, you can do that in Settings > Wireless & networks."

Touch Next" to continue with setup.
Touch "Back to connect to a different WLAN network.
"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to WLAN."

"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to WLAN.
This setting affects all users on this phone."
Metered networks are treated like mobile when background data is restricted. Apps may warn before using these networks for large downloads.
To select metered networks, turn WLAN on.

"You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customise with apps, wallpaper and so on. Users can also adjust device settings like WLAN that affect everyone.
When you add a new user, that person needs to set up their space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."
Allow modification of WLAN and Mobile settings
